communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any incident reports, restraint forms, and Use of Force After-Action Reports generated by incidents occurring on April 15, 2025, at FDC Miami.
- Any video surveillance footage of an April 15, 2025, disturbance at FDC Miami, which was reported in local media and confirmed by BOP: https://www.local10.com/news/local/2025/04/16/disruptive-detainees-treated-for-minor-injuries-in-miami-federal-jail-incident-authorities-say/

Please note that the required by law under 5 U.S.C. § 552(b) to produce any “reasonably segregable” portion of records being withheld. The duty to segregate ensures that agencies are not allowed to issue “sweeping, generalized claims of exemption for documents." Mead Data Cent., Inc., v. U.S. Dep’t of Air Force, 566 F.2d 242, 260 (D.C. Cir. 1977)

Regarding the surveillance footage, please note the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals opinion in Michael S. Evans v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. USCA Case #18-5068 (D.C. Cir. 2020). In that case, the circuit court held that the video surveillance footage is subject to the same segregability standards as other FOIA records. ("It is not at all clear why the government could not at least isolate some screenshots that would meet the same sort of segregability standards typically applied to printed material." Id.)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Wyoming Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wyoming Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: Your Wyoming Department of Corrections public records request #25-273 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Wyoming Department of Corrections ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-273 has been submitted successfully. In compliance with the Wyoming Public Records Act, this letter is your 7 day response to your request for access to public records which was received by Wyoming Department of Corrections (WDOC) on the date listed in this response.  The WDOC is compiling and reviewing the records in response to your request. The WDOC must extend the response time of your request from seven (7) days to thirty (30) days due to the high volume of public record request we receive. Once prepared, fee payment is due if needed. You will be notified if any fees apply and any work that is completed that requires no charge will be provided.  Please do not hesitate to contact the WDOC through this system if we can be of further assistance. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Wyoming Department of Corrections.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Re: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Good morning,



Please direct your request to Centurion Health, as IDOC contracts its medical and mental health services through them and is not the keeper of these records.



Thank you,




[cid:6366ea9c-d596-4107-95d5-f2d1dea736d8]

 IDOC Public Records

 Indiana Department of Correction

 302 W. Washington St.

 Indianapolis, IN 46204



 Website: www.in.gov/idoc<https://www.in.gov/idoc>

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Thank you for your reply.  Would you happen to have a direct point of contact or email at Centurion so that I may request this information? 

Much thanks, 

Andrew

communications.subject: Re: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Good morning,



There is not a direct contact for Public Records Requests, but here is their regional office contact information:


ADDRESS     

9245 N Meridian St, Suite 111

Indianapolis, IN 46260                               


PHONE 317-912-1272

[cid:8ee2d15c-564d-4729-b4d9-05987b4851c7]

 IDOC Public Records

 302 W. Washington St.

 Indianapolis, IN 46204

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Thank you for your assistance. I will give that contact a try. 

Additionally, could I request the name(s) and contact information for IDOC personnel who oversee mental health programming or coordinate external rehabilitative initiatives, particularly those involving mindfulness, trauma-informed care, or wellness programming? These individuals would be the Indiana government counterparts responsible for overseeing the relationship with Centurion.

I’m currently conducting outreach to explore interest in offering a free, evidence-based meditation program for incarcerated individuals. To do so responsibly, I’d like to speak with the appropriate individuals — whether within Centurion or IDOC — to understand if this might be aligned with existing priorities.

I’m not requesting any confidential records, only public-facing professional contact information.

Thanks again for your time and support.

Warmly,
Andrew Ma
Vipassana Prison Trust

communications.subject: Re: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication:
Good morning,



IDOCs liaison between IDOC and Centurion is Andy Dunigan. He can be reached at adunigan@idoc.in.gov



Thank you,




[cid:e03ad208-2399-4533-80df-f5876910fcb2]

 IDOC Public Records

 Indiana Department of Correction

 302 W. Washington St.

 Indianapolis, IN 46204



 Website: www.in.gov/idoc<https://www.in.gov/idoc>

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Correction)
communications.communication: Thank you very much! Hope you have a great week.

communications.subject: Alaska DOC public records request / additional information needed
communications.communication:
On May 15, 2025,, the Alaska Department of Corrections (DOC) received your public records request (PRR).



You requested the following:


[cid:image002.png@01DBC8B7.C4EBA6F0]

Per AS 40.25.122 and 2 AAC 96.220, the Department may ask if a requester is a party or represents a party in an administrative or judicial litigation with the state in which a requested record is relevant. If the answer is YES, the requester must seek the records in accordance with the rules of procedure applicable in the administrative or judicial proceeding.

Please "reply" to this email: Are you such a requestor? (currently in litigation with the State of Alaska)
Yes or no.

Respectfully,
Betsy

[cid:image001.png@01DBC8B7.1E0E5DF0]

communications.subject: RE: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Hi Betsy, 

Thank you for your message.

I confirm that I am not currently involved in any administrative or judicial litigation with the State of Alaska, nor do I represent a party involved in such litigation.

Please let me know if you need any further clarification.

Best regards,
Andrew Ma
